Articles.Content:
Awesome work as usual frizzank!

Weird, I thought people would love the whole custom flag on the side.

Me too....I think the flag is a great addition to the capsule.
Im going to separate it out as its own place-able object so if people want one they can stick it on the side.

That's a good solution.

Anyway, had a chance to try it out. The detail is great, but I did notice a few bugs:

-When I activated the escape tower to separate (not as in an abort, but after the Redstone was done firing and the LES was no longer necessary) it gave my pod quite a push, making it spin out of control. Happened multiple times after that. Perhaps the decouple force is too strong?

-The rocket retro pack went straight through my Mercury capsule when I fired it for reentry. Only happened once though.

That's a good solution.

Anyway, had a chance to try it out. The detail is great, but I did notice a few bugs:

-When I activated the escape tower to separate (not as in an abort, but after the Redstone was done firing and the LES was no longer necessary) it gave my pod quite a push, making it spin out of control. Happened multiple times after that. Perhaps the decouple force is too strong?

-The rocket retro pack went straight through my Mercury capsule when I fired it for reentry. Only happened once though.

You mean its not suppose to do that? It has a decoupler and an engine so just hitting the stage button will do both. The decouple force on the tower is a bit strong.

Hate being that guy, but Mercury Unfolding Antenna?

ADDITIONAL:

The Mercury does not like landing on land:

Safe landing!

I've got that sinking feeling.

esplod

Edited November 27, 2013 by Deltac
Yea I saw that would be a cool antenna to start with for it.
Dang it, I edited my post 2 seconds after you posted yours, meaning you probably didn't see what I added
Its ok I do it too sometimes
Count me in for the flag as well

So given some did not like the flags on the side, I cut it off onto its own part. Now if you wish you can cover your ship with a display of patriotic flags.

1, 2x, and 4x sizes.

I had to make them thick to accommodate all of the surfaces they would stick on.
Thats very cool when can we download

Thats very cool when can we download

When it's released, which will happen when it's done. In general, just don't ask for ETA's - while some modders are willing to give them, most modders will find it extremely annoying.

The Mercury retro pack going through the capsule happened again. It's weird because I never had that problem with the stock Mk1 pod we had to use before as a Mercury capsule stand-in.

One way to solve this (I've tried it out myself) is to have the Pod be a decoupler instead of the retropack. Just a weak 10 force decoupler at the bottom node sends the retropack on its merry way. It also solves the problem with being unable to decouple the liquid fueled retropack, which didn't have a decoupler.

Edited November 27, 2013 by CaptRobau

So the whole its an engine and a decoupler got annoying, so I came up with a clever solution. It now sits on top of a tiny decoupler that has straps on it.

Just don't complain that the straps don't separate like they do in real life!

It works and Looks Cool, Just Accept It!!!!

More realism, and easier to use!

Is so realistic,i like Mercury and i wait this release much time!

You have to your plans you add an IVA or you keep the mk1pod?

Thanks!

Also, are you going to add RCS to the capsule?

EDIT: Oh, and there's another thing. Could we get a single-part "warhead" nosecone? The real Titan II didn't carry any MIRVs, Peacekeeper and Minuteman did. Titan had only one, humongous "city buster" warhead.

Edited November 27, 2013 by Guest

Yes, I know. I just like it better this way.

I am no longer taking part requests for FASA, please check back between the hours of 4 and 5 EST and direct requests to our customer service department.
Haven't had a chance to flight the pre-release yet, but I'm digging the, texture, flag holder and the retro-pack straps. Thanks frizzank.

Yes, I know. I just like it better this way.

I am no longer taking part requests for FASA, please check back between the hours of 4 and 5 EST and direct requests to our customer service department.

4 and 5 in the morning or in the evening? I've got a couple of small requests. Mostly minor Titan-related stuff, like 6 and 7 segment SRBs, nuke nosecone, longer 1st stage tank, stuff like that. Mostly the SRBs, I can jury-rig the rest myself.

4 and 5 in the morning or in the evening? I've got a couple of small requests. Mostly minor Titan-related stuff, like 6 and 7 segment SRBs, nuke nosecone, longer 1st stage tank, stuff like that. Mostly the SRBs, I can jury-rig the rest myself.

Hint: there is no customer service department.

I know, that's why I'm posting those here in the dead of the night. I've been looking through Titan family and noticed that a stretched 1st stage tank and 2 extended (not exactly stretched, they had 1 or 2 more segments) SRBs would allow construction of pretty much the whole family except of 1 and 4B. 4B would require USRM boosters (which would have to be made from scratch) and 1 would require a new 2nd stage. That would take quite a bit of work, unlike adding another, slightly longer 1st stage tank variant and making longer SRBs.

Edited November 28, 2013 by Guest

Yes, I know. I just like it better this way.

I am no longer taking part requests for FASA...

I appreciate the gumption it takes to reply to this with a bunch of requests. Wait, I dont think that's the right word...
Out of curiosity, I know this pack isn't a "museum", but how far off the .64 "rule" are FASA parts?

Yeah, Dragon, when the mod author tells you explicitly not to post something, please respect that.

64% of 3.05 would be 1.952m in diameter, instead of 2.5.
Eh, there goes my Mars Observer launch...
